newsitem.title: USA: Jean Philippe sees improved earnings in Q3.
newsitem.headline: Jean Philippe sees improved earnings in Q3.

text.p: Jean Philippe Fragrances Inc said Thursday it expects to see a trend of improved earnings beginning in the third quarter of 1997, which is when it expects to see the positive impact of some recent changes.
The company said that during the quarter, it matched its competition's pricing structure and lowered its selling prices.
The company said it gave up its Cutex license, and restructured its domestic operations and reduced its domestic work force by more than 20 percent.
The company said these moves should help it significantly reduce its domestic selling, general and administrative expenses.
The company reported first quarter earnings per share of $0.04 compared to $0.18 for the same period a year ago.
